flow.descriptionCdata:
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.0e8aa1f0-6661-441f-a19e-743f390104d0.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.22d25d86-65ae-47f3-b6ec-e5ab2b4388f0.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.2fd33548-8328-4e24-aeb9-50d42c225662.description=
Executes a command from the command line of a remote RAS.

On unix we cannot mandate what type of shell to be used (sh, bash, ksh, csh, etc), so be sure to include the shell in your command
if you need things like file redirection.  Example\:
sh -c "ls -lha /etc > /tmp/myfile"

On Windows, this command will prepend cmd.exe /C or command.exe /C to the command you specify, so there is no need to pass that into this operation.

Inputs\:
    command - the command to execute.
    arguments - any arguments to command.
    environment - Specifies environment variables/values that need to be defined when running command.
    path - The path to the commands executable
    cmd_timeout - Timeout in milliseconds before the command is considered failed when returnImmediately is false.
Default value\: 100000 (100 seconds).
    returnImmediately - If true, the operation will execute the command and return immediately.  It will not wait for the command to finish.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: false.

Responses\:
    success - The command executed successfully.
    failure - The command failed to execute.

Results\:
    STDOUT - The standard output of the command.
    STDERR - The standard error output of the command.
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.3a55b507-1d36-4b28-a1a8-a97960e684ec.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers or strings

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.
operation - The operation to perform (+ - * ^ / > < \=\= \!\= >\= <\=).

Responses\:
success -  The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.

Returns\:
The raw result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Returns\:
Field 1 - The first value. Here for compatibility
Field 2 - The second value. Here for compatibility
Field 3 - The operation. Here for compatibility
formatted_result - The formatted result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.4273574f-6e23-48cc-99fb-f95a74c1762e.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.6bb7d95b-e43f-4dc7-924b-7d3d21c2bca8.description=
Operation to transform the case of inputs

Inputs\:

inputList\:  comma seperated list of variables to check
caseType\: upper or lower; this is the case to transform to - if left blank, will default to lower.
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.b61212a2-5d7d-4bec-8b02-c6d5b862a591.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.bf1e652d-4ad7-4e21-ac13-614302a28751.description=
Operation to check for null or empty string local variables.

Inputs\:

inputList\:  comma seperated list of variables to check

Reponsses\:
hasNull\:  at least one variable is null or has an empy string for a value
noNulls\:  all variables have a value

Result\:  List of variables that are null or empty strings
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.bf942a74-9706-4a98-a1ff-f872c760fdbf.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.cddd3519-ab01-48c6-b0cb-7bf0e4abd13b.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.d25bc020-2fee-47d0-924e-f1088bbff6f0.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.d622d105-9839-4242-83cf-da6bab2d9d15.description=
Service to validate an XML document. Input must be given for either 'xmlDocument' or for 'xmlLocation'. The 'xsdLocation' input is optional, but if specified then the XML document will be validated against the XSD schema.

Inputs\: 
xmlDocument - The contents of a XML document as a string.
xmlLocation 	 - A fully qualified URL to a HTTP-accessible XML document (i.e WSDL) or the complete path to a local XML document.
xsdLocation   - A fully qualified URL to a HTTP-accessible XSD schema document or the complete path to a local XSD schema document to validate the XML against.  The XSD schema document must be a World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Schema, sometimes referred to as WXS.

Responses\:
valid xml document 	- A valid XML document was found.
invalid xml document 	- Invalid XML document was found.
xml document not found 	- XML document was not found at the given location.
failure 		- General failure while trying to retrieve an XML document or XSD document if specified.

Note\: This operation will fail if a proxy server is required to access the URL specified by 'xmlLocation'. In such cases, use an appropriate HTTP Client operation (for example, Http Client Get) to retrieve the contents of the XML document at the given URL and use it as input for 'xmlDocument' instead.
5e183225-bbf7-4a73-8aa2-54fc26e11e58.description=
Synopsis

    This flow retrieves a list of network interfaces based on the inputs received. Optional inputs restrict the search; if none are given, all interfaces are returned.
    getNetInterfaces performs the following steps\:
      1. Pass the flow inputs in and assign the optional argument variables for the configuration.
      2. Call the remote action server (RAS) perl with the inputs.
      3. Validate the XML document from the RAS results. If the code is invalid, the flow errors out.
      4. If the code is valid, query the results for a status.
      5. Pass the information to the requesting entity.

Inputs

   clusterName - The IP or host name of the NetApp cluster; specifies endpoint to run the API against (required).     
      Valid values\: Dot-decimal notation IPv4 address or RFC 1123 compliant host name.
      Default value\: None.

    node - The contoller node for the clusterName.
    currentNode - Displays FCP LIFs on the specified node.
    homeNode - The aggregate's disks are assigned to this node name.
    port - A communication endpoint in an operating system.
    currentPort - Displays FCP LIFs on the specified port.
    homePort - The net interfaces are assigned to this port name.
    isHome - Input that specifies whether the interface is a home (or default) interface.
    vServerName - The name of the vServer used in the flow.
    lifName - The name of the LIF.
    role - 
    protocol - The protocol of the volume (CIFS, NAS, etc.). A protocol relates to the operating system utilized in storage deployment.
    ip - The internet protocol (IP) for the interface.
    netMask - The net mask of the IP address.
    netMaskLength - The maximum length for the net mask.
    fg - The failover group assigned to the cluster.
    useFg - Input that specifies if the failover group should be used.
    failoverPolicy – The policy for the failover group.
    rg -  
    domain - A domain is an identifier of a particular area on the internet;  in this case the domain of the server. The network name of the domain or workgroup the CIFS server belongs to.
    fireWallPolicy – The policy to allow access to the firewall.
    isAutoRevert - Input that specifies if the interface is automatically reverted when rollback happens.
    isipv4linklocal - Input that determines if the IPV4 link is local.
    admin - The administrator credentials for the network interface.
    status - The status of the network.
    comment - Any comments on the network.
    optArgVars- A query that specifies which  argument variables to return for the configuration (required).
      Valid values\: Implementation-specific.
      Default value\: None.

    overrideJRAS - Value to override the system-defined Java RAS server.
      Valid values\: Implementation-specific.
      Default value\: Hosting Eng RAS.

Results

    hpooFlowResult - The XML response specific to the functionality of the flow; in this case network interfaces.
    flowStatus - Overall status of the flow, value is one of the string literals "success" or "failed".
    Invalid XML document - The XML document returned in the response is not valid.

Responses

    Success - All operations and subflows completed successfully.
    Failure - Some operations and/or subflows failed.

Notes

    1.
flow.name: modifyVserverConfig

step.name: Log Vars for NULL Input Error

staticBinding.value: invalid XML document returned from successful NetApp API RAS operation: exit status = ${exitStatus}
invalid XML document returned from failed NetApp API RAS operation: exit status = ${exitStatus}
